page.title: 15NATURE CONSERVANCY COUNCIL
page.content: The{NATURE CONSERVANCY COUNCIL}_formed 1949 by Royal Charter, took over the management of a large part of { {Wychwood Forest,}approximately 262 ha in {1955,}when the area was designated a{site of special scientific interest. This was due to the abundance of rare flora and fauna and the antiquity of the forest. By restricting access to persons declaring an interest in, and respect for the conservation of all aspects of the forest,it has been possible to preserve much of the natural beauty of the area. Guided parties of not more than {20 persons} are shown around the area maintained by the {N.C.C.,}by voluntary wardens who live in the locality.
